      genre       : electronic    
      cat#        : n/a

      type        : album
   _______________________________________________________________________

      Now, after a year of touring (with Gym Class Heroes, Fall Out
      Boy and Young Love, among others), Daniel Hunter is ready to
      unleash his first full-length opus, Texas. Says Hunter, a
      die-hard Cowboys fan: "I named it for the love of the state.
      I assumed somebody had named their album &#039;Texas&#039; before, but
      no one had. I had to do it before someone else did!"

      The songs showcase a slightly heavier guitar sound, but
      maintain Hunter&#039;s quirky outlook and pop aesthetic. "I
      actually write my guitar stuff first," says themusician.
      "Then I compliment it with some beats or keyboards." But
      whatever the case, there&#039;s definitely diversity at work. The
      ballad "Pirate and Princess" features almost orchestral
      flourishes, while "Tooth Decay" is more acoustic-based. The
      album also marks the first time Hunter has worked with a
      producer (Garrett Lee) and live drums.

      Although the Postal Service and "poptronica" have been used
      to describe PlayRadioPlay!&#039;s gentle beats and
      keyboard-centric songs, Hunter has created his own phrase to
      describe the sound. "It&#039;s Texas Straight-edge Softcore," he
      says, laughing. "I mean, I&#039;m making fun of straight-edge
      hardcore? a genre that I am not. Why can&#039;t there be
      straight-edge softcore?"
